title: Leading in Medium and High-Tech Manufacturing
description: In 2022, Myanmar's medium and high-tech manufacturing value added constituted 92.58% of its total manufacturing value added, showcasing a strong emphasis on advanced manufacturing sectors.

title: High Female Representation in Tertiary Education Staff
description: As of 2018, 84.53% of academic staff in Myanmar's tertiary education sector were female, indicating a significant gender balance in higher education employment.

title: Low Livestock Production Index
description: In 2022, Myanmar's livestock production index was 35.52, reflecting one of the lowest levels of livestock production compared to the 2014-2016 baseline.

title: Minimal Human Resource Development
description: Myanmar's CPIA building human resources rating was 1.5 in 2023, indicating significant challenges in developing human capital.

title: Weak Property Rights and Governance
description: In 2023, Myanmar received a CPIA property rights and rule-based governance rating of 1, highlighting substantial governance challenges.

title: Limited Trade Facilitation
description: With a CPIA trade rating of 1.5 in 2023, Myanmar faces considerable obstacles in trade facilitation and integration into global markets.

title: Low Value in Food and Beverage Manufacturing
description: In 2020, food, beverages, and tobacco accounted for only 0.29% of Myanmar's manufacturing value added, indicating a minimal contribution from this sector.

title: Negligible Machinery and Transport Equipment Manufacturing
description: As of 2020, machinery and transport equipment made up just 0.006% of Myanmar's manufacturing value added, reflecting a very small industrial base in this sector.

title: Short Compulsory Education Duration
description: Myanmar mandates only 5 years of compulsory education as of 2023, one of the shortest durations globally, impacting educational attainment.

title: Low Prevalence of Overweight in Children
description: In 2018, only 0.5% of female children under 5 in Myanmar were overweight, indicating low levels of childhood obesity.

title: Minimal Childhood Overweight Prevalence
description: The modeled estimate for 2024 shows only 0.6% of children under 5 in Myanmar are overweight, reflecting low obesity rates among young children.
